perturbation.original_text:
From time to time, WebMD will provide Content that supersedes and replaces Content previously provided (for example, a corrected news
article). Promptly after receipt of replacement Content, Emdeon will either (a) remove the superseded Content and replace it with the replacement
Content or (b) note at the top of the superseded Content that it has been replaced and give a hypertext link to the replacement Content.
perturbation.changed_text:
From time to time, WebMD may provide Content that supersedes and replaces Content previously provided (for example, a corrected news
article). Upon receipt of replacement Content, Emdeon will endeavor to either (a) remove the superseded Content and replace it with the replacement
Content or (b) note at the top of the superseded Content that it has been possibly replaced and give a link to the replacement Content.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'will provide' to 'may provide', the obligation for WebMD to provide updated content becomes discretionary. Additionally, replacing 'Promptly' with 'Upon receipt' and 'will either' with 'will endeavor to either', introduces ambiguity about the timeliness and certainty of updating the content. It does not specifically state the length of time until content has to be updated, and is thus, ambigious.
perturbation.contradicted_law: This could lead to the distribution of outdated or inaccurate medical information, which may violate consumer protection laws such as those enforced by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) regarding deceptive or unfair practices if the content leads to harm.

perturbation.original_text:
The receiving party agrees to take reasonable precautions (no less
rigorous than the receiving party takes with respect to its own comparable Confidential Information and Trade Secrets) to prevent unauthorized or
inadvertent disclosure of the Confidential Information and Trade Secrets of the disclosing party.
perturbation.changed_text:
The receiving party agrees to consider taking precautions similar to those it deems appropriate for its own information to minimize unauthorized or
inadvertent disclosure of the Confidential Information and Trade Secrets of the disclosing party.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'take reasonable precautions (no less rigorous than...)' with 'consider taking precautions similar to those it deems appropriate...' significantly weakens the obligation to protect confidential information. The standard is now subjective ('deems appropriate') and the action ('consider taking') is not mandatory. This creates uncertainty about the level of security implemented.
perturbation.contradicted_law: This could violate HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) if the confidential information includes Protected Health Information (PHI), as HIPAA mandates specific and stringent security measures.

perturbation.original_text:
All material notices and other communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and notices will be
deemed given three (3) days after they are sent by first class mail, return receipt requested, and one (1) day after they are sent by overnight courier
or upon receipt if delivered by hand delivery, to the receiving party’s address as set forth in the first paragraph above, or to such other address that
the receiving party may have provided in writing to the other party for purposes of receiving notices as provided in this Section.
perturbation.changed_text:
All material notices and other communications related to this Agreement should, when practical, be in writing and notices may be
deemed given sometime after they are sent by mail, and/or courier
or upon delivery, to the receiving party’s address.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing 'shall be' with 'should, when practical', and 'will be deemed given three (3) days after' with 'may be deemed given sometime after', the requirement for written notice and a defined timeline for deemed receipt becomes discretionary and vague. The removal of 'return receipt requested' and 'overnight courier' further weakens the provision.
perturbation.contradicted_law: This could create issues related to breach of contract claims, as the uncertainty regarding notification could impede the ability to provide adequate notice of default or termination, potentially violating principles of contract law requiring clear and timely notification.
